result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam Leroy Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Extended Supervision and Probation conditions same
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for May 23, 2014 at 1:30pm.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: supervision fees, and DNA, DV and victim/witness surcharges to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision if revoked, otherwise due during probation period, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.

Batterers Intervention program, or a course in anger management.
Mental health evaluation, comply with recommended treatment.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
Court advised defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. 
Provide DNA sample.
AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Adam Leroy Thompson not in court.  Michael D Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  Per email from Probation Dept., defendant is currently in absconder status.  Court ordered defendant to serve 0 days of the condition time; straight time.
At the request of the probation agent, the 5/23/14 probation review is rescheduled to 6/27/14 at 1:30 pm.   rmm

Defendant Adam Leroy Thompson in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Defendant Adam Leroy Thompson in custody.  Brittany C. Grayson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  BRANCH 38 FOR BRANCH 40.
  Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 3:  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 YEARS, consecutive, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 30 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Batterers Intervention program, or a course in anger management.
-Mental health evaluation, comply with recommended treatment.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim. 
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: supervision fees, and DNA, DV, and Victim/Witness surcharges to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision if revoked, otherwise due during probation period, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. 
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. 
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for May 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Adam Leroy Thompson in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Defendant Adam Leroy Thompson in custody.  Brittany C. Grayson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 40.
Matter was set for jury trial today but as resolved.  Pursuant to negotiations, counts 1 and 2 are ordered DISMISSED AND READ IN by the Court.
As to count 3:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty of count 3 in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

Attorney Leah R Thomas in court, defendant Adam Leroy Thompson not in court, in custody.  Brittany C. Grayson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 3/05/14 in Branch 40.  Defense counsel informed the Court she does not have to withdraw from this case.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.

Defendant Adam Leroy Thompson in court with attorney Leah R Thomas.  Defendant Adam Leroy Thompson in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson for Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial conference.  Defense counsel would like an adjournment as she may have a conflict with this matter.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
from the state received and filed.  rmm
from the defense received and filed.  rmm
from the defense received and filed.  rmm

Attorney Leah R Thomas in court, defendant Adam Leroy Thompson not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Case remains set for final pretrial and jury trial.

Scheduling Conference held.  On motion of the state, Court ordered 13CM5623 and 14CF132 joined for the purpose of trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adam Leroy Thompson in court with attorney Leah R Thomas.  Defendant Adam Leroy Thompson in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CAMILLE W.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

ADDRESS INFO for Adam Leroy Thompson
Current: 2416 N 38TH ST, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 01-11-2014)
Prior: 3414 West Wisconsin Avenue #104, Milwaukee, WI 53208

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION with ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Adam Leroy Thompson in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Adam Leroy Thompson in custody.  Nicholas S. Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant pled not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNTS 1 & 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant HAS A LOWER PENDING CASE AND is advised this case is assigned to Judge DALLET, Branch 40.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 40.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
